intro: Zephyranthes vittata, commonly known as the striped rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a bulbous base. Zephyranthes vittata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is known to bloom during the rainy season.
